revised_title: A Detailed Account of the Weather and Seasons in Lyndon, Rutland, 1776
tldr: This article provides a detailed account of the weather and seasonal changes in Lyndon, Rutland, in 1776. It includes records of barometer and thermometer readings, as well as observations on the impact of the weather on agriculture and local flora and fauna. The author notes the dry spring and summer, followed by a wetter August, and the effects of these conditions on the local crops and fruit harvests.
